greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle read by rows, k!*S_4(n, k) where S_m(n, k) are the Stirling-Frobenius subset numbers of order m; n >= 0, k >= 0.
comment: The Stirling-Frobenius subset numbers are defined in A225468 (see also the Sage program).
formula: For a recurrence see the Maple program.
Recurrence: T(n, -1) = 0, T(0, 0) = 1, T(n, k) = 0 if n < k and T(n, k) =
4*k*T(n-1, k-1) + (3 + 4*k)*T(n-1, k) for n >= 1, k = 0..n  (see the Maple program).
E.g.f. row polynomials R(n, x) = Sum_{m=0..n} T(n, k)*x^k: exp(3*z)/(1 - x*(exp(4*z) - 1)).
maple: SF_SO := proc(n, k, m) option remember;
if n = 0 and k = 0 then return(1) fi;
if k > n or k < 0 then return(0) fi;
m*k*SF_SO(n-1, k-1, m) + (m*(k+1)-1)*SF_SO(n-1, k, m) end:
mathematica: EulerianNumber[n_, k_, m_] := EulerianNumber[n, k, m] = (If[ n == 0, Return[If[k == 0, 1, 0]]]; Return[(m*(n-k)+m-1)*EulerianNumber[n-1, k-1, m] + (m*k+1)*EulerianNumber[n-1, k, m]]); SFSO[n_, k_, m_] := Sum[ EulerianNumber[n, j, m]*Binomial[j, n-k], {j, 0, n}]; Table[ SFSO[n, k, 4], {n, 0, 8}, {k, 0, n}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, May 29 2013, translated from Sage *)
program: if n == 0: return 1 if k == 0 else 0
return add(EulerianNumber(n, j, m)*binomial(j, n - k) for j in (0..n))
for n in (0..6): [SF_SO(n, k, 4) for k in (0..n)]
results.author: _Peter Luschny_, May 17 2013
